alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:57AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sandy Creek at Havre. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, At 11 feet, water overflows Road 50. April 17, 2018 Notes: When the Big Sandy gauge was around 11 Feet, Road 50 actually washed out. The water was about 18 inches above the road when it washed out. One 16 foot culvert was in place at that time. The rough location of Road 50 and Big Sandy Creek is about 7 miles north of the casino on Highway 87, then go 3 miles west. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Friday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM MDT Friday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet tomorrow morning and will then hold steady for the next couple of days. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 01/01/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or before this evening at 1000 PM MDT.
